title: I, Robot movie credits typeface
content:
Does anybody know the font used at the movie "I robot"?   
At the advertisments and website there are several fonts in use. I mean the font at the end of the movie showing the credits.
author: caliban

comments.content:
Look inside your computer... It's the type they use on the boards like video-cards and such. The S is a giveaway. It's a lot like the type generated by the 'titling machines' you could fasten onto your drawing board in the 'old days', eg build up out of straightish segments.   
I went to see the movie today ; ) and the credits sequence animation is like circuitry builing up et cetera.   
For the font itself: I guess a circuitry drawing program would probably include (a) similar font(s) or you could try specific sites.
Bank Gothic was used on posters. But it is not similar to the end-credtis font. You have to see the movie to know, what I mean.

OCR-B comes close, but not quite, though it has the characteristic straight ends in contrast to the other OCR's that are even more monoline and have round ends.   
I did a search for Printed Circuit Board (PCB) software, but the two available programs available for OS X did not include fonts like the one I mean... (one used Chicago, the other a sticktype of premade artwork).

Ilja, that's what Bert was explaining: it's the type used on the boards   
like video cards and such. Bert, was it something like [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20141004084241/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ocr)?
